symptoms.name: Profuse watery diarrhea
symptoms.pattern: 90-95% of cases, onset within 7 days of antibiotic initiation, within 2-21 days of cessation

symptoms.name: Bloody diarrhea
symptoms.pattern: Should prompt investigation for other causes

symptoms.name: Dehydration
symptoms.pattern: Can be life-threatening in severe cases

symptoms.name: Toxic megacolon
symptoms.pattern: Rare, life-threatening complication requiring emergency surgery

symptoms.name: Joint pain, inflammation, and swelling (reactive arthritis)
Albumin loss
symptoms.pattern: Can cause leaky blood vessels and swelling

vital_signs.heart_rate: May be elevated in severe cases
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be decreased in severe cases due to dehydration

physical_findings: Few and nonspecific unless fulminant disease is present

lab_values.stool_toxin_assay: Positive for toxin B in most cases
lab_values.complete_blood_count: Leukocytosis (increased white blood cell count) in 80% of cases
lab_values.albumin: May be decreased in severe cases due to albumin loss

risk_factors: Immunosuppression (elderly patients, transplant patients, cancer patients)
Hospitalization or residence in long-term care facilities

imaging_findings.computed_tomography(CT): Nonspecific findings including diffuse pancolonic wall thickening, mucosal edema, thumbprinting, doughnut-like appearance of the ascending and descending colon, and colonic dilatation. Small bowel usually spared.

required: Positive stool toxin assay for Clostridium difficile toxin B

differential_diagnoses: Infectious colitis due to other pathogens
